title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

Decimal approximations must be correct to three places after the decimal point by rounding or truncating. Decimal values of 0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIWaaaaa@39B6@ in final digits need not be reported ( 2.000=2.00=2.0=2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4570@ ).

  • A decimal presentation error occurs when a response is complete and correct, but the answer is reported to fewer digits than required.

  • The first decimal presentation error in this question does not earn the point. For each additional part of this question that requires a decimal approximation and contains a decimal presentation error, the response is eligible to earn the point.

  • The final number in (ii) may be reported as 59 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaI1aGaaGyoaaaa@3A7E@ thousand or 60 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaI2aGaaGimaaaa@3A76@ thousand provided the supporting work has a correct decimal approximation for the estimate.

  • A response is eligible to earn points for (i) and (ii) with a correct translation to “thousands.” Use of 40,000 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D52@ and 76,000 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D5B@ results in an answer of 395.604 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E25@ in (i).
descriptions:
The student response includes none of these criteria.

  • Average rate of change in (i) as a decimal approximation, with supporting work that includes a quotient that uses the given data values. Units are not needed and are ignored if presented.

  • Estimate in (ii) using average rate of change from (i) with supporting work.

    NOTES:

    • If a response earned the point in (i) without a decimal presentation error, then an estimate in the range [ 59.750,59.805 ] MathType@MTEF@5@5@@447B@ (OR if “thousands” are used, then the range is [ 59,750, 59,805 ] MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4602@ ) earns the second point in the presence of supporting work.

    • If (i) has a decimal presentation error, the reported value in (i) as the average rate of change can be used to arrive at an estimate in (ii). To earn the point, the estimate in (ii) must be consistent with both the reported value in (i) and the endpoint used in the supporting work in (ii).

    • If (i) is incorrect, the reported value in (i) as the average rate of change can be used to arrive at an estimate in (ii). To earn the point, the estimate in (ii) must be consistent with both the reported value in (i) and the endpoint used in the supporting work in (ii).

  • Answer with explanation in (iii). The reasoning must include two components.

    • The graph of G MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGhbaaaa@39C8@ is concave down OR the rate of change of G MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGhbaaaa@39C8@ is decreasing AND

    • A reference to the use of a secant line on 0<t<91 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E35@ OR the use of a linear function with reference to endpoints 0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIWaaaaa@39B6@ and 91 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaI5aGaaGymaaaa@3A7A@ that provide the placement of the line

  • Two components when neither point in (i) or (ii) is earned. One of the following:

    • Correct quotient in (i) that uses the given data values that is not expressed as a decimal approximation

    • Correct quotient in (i) that uses the given data values and has a decimal presentation error

    • Correct average rate of change in (i) that does not include supporting work

      AND One of the following:

    • Correct estimate in (ii) that does not include supporting work

    • Correct supporting work in (ii) that does not provide an estimate

The student response includes one of these criteria.

  • Average rate of change in (i) as a decimal approximation, with supporting work that includes a quotient that uses the given data values. Units are not needed and are ignored if presented.

  • Estimate in (ii) using average rate of change from (i) with supporting work.
